original: Bergström, Levi, fd. lasarettsläkare, Jönköping, f. 7/7/79 i Luleå av stadskassör Carl Jonas B. o. Hilda Johanna Bucht. G. 10 m. Anni Wallmark. Barn: Halvar f. 11, Ingrid 13, Bertil 15, Sven 17, Ellen Maria 20, Carl Jonas 23. — Mog:ex. i Luleå 98, med. kand. i Upps. 04, med. lic. där 10. Stud:res. t. Norge, Skottl. o. Engl. 22. Div. förordn. s. aman. o. assist :läk. 06-10, und:kir. i Upps. 10-11, tf. över-kir. där 11, förest, v. röntgenavd. i Upps. samt förest, f. stat. prov. vanfö-reanst. i Säter 12, tf. las :läk. i bl. a. Filipstad, Örgryte, Sollefteå, Visby, Karlstad o. Linköp. 13-15, förste und:-läk. v. Örebro las. kir. avd. 16-19, tf. las :läk. i Hälsingborg, Växjö o. Ljungby 19, lasiläk. i Ljungby 19-29, l,as:-läk. v. Jönköp. las. kir. avd. o. sty-resm. 29, efter pens. prakt. läk. i Jönköp. Led. av kommrfullm. i Ljungby 20-29, led. av direkt, f. Ryhovs sjukh. i Jönköp. sed. 35, landstingsman. Skr.: ett antal smärre upps. i div. kir. ämnen. RNO.
translated: Bergström, Levi, former hospital physician, Jönköping, born on July 7th, 1879 in Luleå to city treasurer Carl Jonas B. and Hilda Johanna Bucht. Married in 1910 to Anni Wallmark. Children: Halvar born in 1911, Ingrid in 1913, Bertil in 1915, Sven in 1917, Ellen Maria in 1920, Carl Jonas in 1923. He received his Bachelor of Medicine degree from Uppsala University in 1904, and his Medical Licence there in 1910. He went on study trips to Norway, Scotland, and England in 1922. He held various positions as an assistant and assisting physician from 1906-1910, an assistant surgeon in Uppsala from 1910-1911, temporary chief surgeon there in 1911, head of the X-ray department and head of the laboratory for testing disabled patients in Säter in 1912, temporary hospital physician in various places including Filipstad, Örgryte, Sollefteå, Visby, Karlstad, and Linköping from 1913-1915, first assistant physician in the surgical department of Örebro hospital from 1916-1919, temporary hospital physician in Helsingborg, Växjö, and Ljungby in 1919, hospital physician in Ljungby from 1919-1929, hospital physician in the surgical department and board member of Jönköping hospital from 1929, and retired as a practicing physician in Jönköping. He was a member of the municipal council in Ljungby from 1920-1929, a member of the board of Ryhov Hospital in Jönköping since 1935, and a member of the county council. Author of several minor papers on various surgical subjects. RNO (Knight of the Royal Order of the North Star).
